member.returns: A object representing the newly created item.

summary.para: Lists the values that specify names of commands that can be performed by clicking toolbar items.
A command that discards any changes made to the current card and switches the Card View to browse mode.
A command that clears the filter applied to the current column.
A command that clears sorting by the current column.
A custom user command.
A command that deletes the current card.
A command that deletes the selected cards on a page.
A command that allows users to edit the current card.
A command that creates a new card.
A command that refreshes grid data.
A command that controls the card footer visibility.
A command that controls the card header visibility.
A command that controls the header panel visibility.
A command that controls the search panel visibility.
A command that controls the “Summary Panel” visibility.
A command that saves all the changes made to the current card and switches the Card View to browse mode.

summary.para: List values that define the type of Pie Chart series‘ argument values.
The data type is determined automatically.
A chart displays values of a data or time type.
A chart displays values of a numeric type.
A chart displays values of the string type.
Lists values defining the mode in which chart elements are selected.
Multiple chart elements can be selected.
Only one chart element can be selected.
Lists the values that define what series elements to highlight when a corresponding item in the legend is hovered over.
When a legend item is hovered over, the corresponding series is highlighted, but its points are excluded.
When a legend item is hovered over, the corresponding series is highlighted along with its points.
A legend hover does not affect a chart appearance.
Lists values defining the type of chart points.
Circular chart points.
Cross chart points.
Polygonal chart points.
Square chart points.
Triangle-down chart points.
Triangle-up chart points.
Lists values that define how a chart control resolves label overlapping.
Resolve overlapping by hiding labels. Labels to be hidden are determined automatically.
Do not resolve label overlapping.
Arrange labels in a stack.
Specifies how to aggregate series points.
Calculates the average of all point values in an interval.
Calculates the number of points in an interval.
Applies a custom aggregate function specified in the BootstrapChartAggregationSettings.OnCalculate property.
Calculates the maximum point value in an interval.
Calculates the minimum point value in an interval.
The default aggregation method for the corresponding series type.
Calculates the first open, last close, minimum low, and maximum high value in an interval.
Calculates the range of values in an interval.
Calculates the sum of all point values in an interval.
Lists values that define how value error bars are displayed.
Required value error bars (low and/or high) are determined automatically.
Only high value error bars are displayed.
Only low value error bars are displayed.
Value error bars are not displayed.
Lists the values that define how error bar values must be calculated.
The error bars type is undefined.
Defines the confidential interval in constant values.
Defines the confidential interval in percentages.
Defines the standard deviation.
Defines the standard deviation of its sampling distribution.
Defines the variance.
Lists the values that define whether users are allowed to zoom and/or pan chart axes.
Zooming and panning are allowed.
Neither zooming nor panning is allowed.
The default mode (“none”) is used.
Only panning is allowed.
Only zooming is allowed.
Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

Lists the values that specify a predefined type of text formatting.
A value is divided by one billion, the letter ‘B’ is added.
Displays a value as currency.
Displays a value as a day.
Displays a value as a day of the week.
Displays a value in the decimal format with an optional negative sign.
Displays a value in the exponential notation.

Displays the value as an hour.
A value is divided by a number (one thousand, one million, one billion or one trillion) so that the value is less than a thousand; then a corresponding letter (‘K’, ‘M’, ‘B’ or ‘T’) is added.
Displays a value using the long date format.
Thursday, January 01, 1970
Displays a value using the long date and long time format.
Thursday, January 01, 1970, 12:00:00 AM
Displays a value using the long time format.
A value is divided by one billion, the letter ‘M’ is added.
Displays a value as milliseconds.
Displays a value as minutes.
Displays a value as a month.
Displays a value using the month and day format.
January 01
Displays a value using the month and year format.
1970 January
Display a value without formatting.
A value is multiplied by 100 and displayed with a percent symbol.
Displays a value using the quarter format.
QI
Displays a value using the quarter and year format.
Displays a value as seconds.
Displays a value using the short date format.
Displays a value using the short date and short time format.
Displays a value using the short time format.

A value is divided by one billion, the letter ‘T’ is added.
The value is displayed as a year.

Lists values that specify how to arrange axis labels when there is insufficient space to keep all of them.
Hides certain axis labels leaving more space for the others.
Leaves axis labels overlapped.
Rotate labels so that they are perpendicular to the axis.
Arrange labels in a staggered manner.
Lists values that specify what to do with colors in a chart control’s palette when their number is less than the number of series (in a Chart) or points in a series (in a Pie Chart).
Repeat the full set of palette colors, alternating their normal, lightened, and darkened shades in that order.
Create a blend of two neighboring colors and insert it between these colors in the palette.
Repeat the full set of palette colors, changing their shade gradually from dark to light.
Lists values of chart behavior when labels overlap. Allows you to hide certain labels, or slightly shift them, or keep them as they are (i.e., overlapping).
The PieChart automatically determines and hides overlapping labels in the order of their addition to the data source.
Default. The label location is specified by default.
The PieChart control tries to shift chart labels to show them without overlapping. If there is not enough space for all labels, the control hides labels with the smallest value.
Lists values that define the direction that the Pie Chart segments will occupy.
The chart slices are laid out counterclockwise starting from the BootstrapPieChart.StartAngle angle.
The chart slices are laid out clockwise starting from the BootstrapPieChart.StartAngle angle.

The Donut chart (synonymous with Doughnut).

The Pie chart.

Lists the values that define the type of the chart axis scale.
A scale type is determined automatically according to scale values.

Default for numeric and date-time values. The scale is divided into equal intervals automatically or you can specify custom intervals using the BootstrapRangeSelectorScale.TickInterval and BootstrapRangeSelectorScale.MinorTickInterval properties.

A logarithmic scale is useful when you visualize a dataset of rapidly-growing values. Each scale tick represents a particular value (BootstrapRangeSelectorScale.LogarithmBase) that is raised to the next power in turn. For example, if you set LogarithmBase to 5, the following ticks will be generated: 5^0, 5^1, 5^2, 5^3, etc.
For internal use only.
For internal use only
For internal use only
For internal use only
For internal use only

The scale type defined automatically based on the applied value.

The scale displays numeric values.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the position of a UI element.

Defines the length of the date-time axis’ displayed range.
Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.
Lists the values that define how the axis’s visual range should behave when chart data is updated.

The applied mode changes depending on the visual range’s position on the axis: at the start or middle - “keep“; at the end - “shift“; if set to view the whole range - “reset“ (the visual range remains equal to the whole range).
The visual range does not change.
The update mode is defined by the underlying control.
The visual range becomes equal to the whole range (specified by the BootstrapChartAxisSettings.WholeRangeStart and BootstrapChartAxisSettings.WholeRangeEnd properties).
The visual range moves to the axis’s end. The range’s length does not change.
